entities: Group of Experts on the DRC
reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports every 90 days, Midterm report no later than 30 December 2023, and a final report no later than 15 June 2024
summary:
Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

Recalling previous resolutions on the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), reaffirms its commitment to the country's sovereignty, independence, unity, and territorial integrity.

Concerned about the presence of armed groups in eastern DRC, the Council demands an end to support for these groups and calls for full implementation of commitments under the Peace and Security Framework.

The Council welcomes efforts by the DRC Government to ensure accountability, including investigations into the killing of two members of the Group of Experts and four Congolese nationals.

The Council:

1. Renews until 1 July 2024 measures set out in paragraphs 1-6 of resolution 2293 (2016).
2. Reaffirms measures targeting individuals and entities designated by the Committee.
3. Reiterates that measures set forth in paragraph 1 of resolution 1807 (2008) continue to apply to non-governmental entities and individuals operating in DRC.
4. Demands States ensure compliance with international law in implementing this resolution.

The Council:

5. Extends until 1 August 2024 the mandate of the Group of Experts, and requests the Secretary-General to re-establish the Group.
6. Calls for enhanced cooperation between States and the Group of Experts and requests reports and updates.
7. Reaffirms reporting provisions set out in resolutions 2360 (2017) and 2478 (2019).
8. Recalls Guidelines of the Committee for the Conduct of its Work and calls on Member States to use them.
9. Recalls the Secretary-General's commitment to ensure perpetrators of the killing of the Group of Experts members are brought to justice.
The Security Council:

Stresses the importance of bringing perpetrators to justice and of continued deployment by the Secretary-General of the Follow-on Mechanism, comprising a senior UN official, four technical experts, and support staff, to the Democratic Republic of the Congo to assist with national investigation, within existing resources;

Decides to remain seized of the matter.
